segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me feel a bit sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I feel sad that he might get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m sad that no one is helping him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, and I feel sad that she’s just waiting for a cookie instead of helping.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should turn around and see what’s happening before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks nice, but inside, it’s a sad little scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the water will ruin the floor and make everything worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookies, and I feel sad that he might fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman is so oblivious to the sadness around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just sad to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
